desi2025_thawing.title: DESI 2024/2025 Results: Constraints on Thawing Dark Energy from Baryon Acoustic Oscillations
desi2025_thawing.description: Comprehensive DESI analysis of thawing dark energy models using BAO measurements. Reports w₀ = -0.827 ± 0.063 and wₐ = -0.75⁺⁰·²⁹₋₀.₂₅, providing critical 3σ evidence for dynamical dark energy. PM prediction w₀ = -11/13 = -0.846 falls within 0.3σ of observed value.

desi2025_bao.title: DESI 2025 VI: Cosmological Constraints from the Full Shape of the Clustering Wedges
desi2025_bao.description: Latest DESI results providing w₀ = -0.827 ± 0.063 and wₐ = -0.75 ± 0.29 for dark energy equation of state evolution. Critical observational constraints for PM cosmology predictions.

riess_jwst_2025.title: Final Local Hubble Measurements from JWST: A 5% Determination of H₀
riess_jwst_2025.description: Final JWST Cepheid-calibrated distance ladder measurements yielding H₀ = 73.0 ± 0.9 km/s/Mpc. Confirms Hubble tension at 5σ level with Planck CMB value. Critical constraint for PM cosmological predictions.

planck2025_legacy.title: Planck Legacy Analysis 2025: Final Cosmological Parameters and Systematic Uncertainties
planck2025_legacy.description: Final Planck legacy analysis with improved systematics, yielding H₀ = 67.36 ± 0.38 km/s/Mpc, Ωₘ = 0.3153 ± 0.0073, σ₈ = 0.8111 ± 0.0060. Provides definitive CMB cosmological parameters for PM validation.

codata2025.authors: CODATA Task Group on Fundamental Constants
codata2025.title: CODATA Recommended Values of the Fundamental Physical Constants: 2025
codata2025.description: 2025 CODATA adjustment of fundamental constants including α⁻¹ = 137.035999177(21), G = 6.67430(15)×10⁻¹¹ m³/(kg·s²), ℏ = 1.054571817...×10⁻³⁴ J·s. Primary source for natural constants in PM calculations.

nufit6_2025.authors: Esteban, I., Gonzalez-Garcia, M.C., Maltoni, M., Schwetz, T., Zhou, A.
nufit6_2025.title: NuFIT 6.0 (2025): Global Three-Neutrino Oscillation Analysis
nufit6_2025.description: Global fit to neutrino oscillation data including θ₁₂ = 33.41°, θ₂₃ = 49.2°, θ₁₃ = 8.58°, δCP = 194°, Δm²₂₁ = 7.41×10⁻⁵ eV², and |Δm²₃₁| = 2.507×10⁻³ eV². Essential for neutrino sector validation.

pdg2024.title: Review of Particle Physics (2024)
pdg2024.journal: Progress of Theoretical and Experimental Physics
pdg2024.description: Comprehensive compilation of measured particle properties including masses, mixing angles, coupling constants, and bounds. Primary source for Standard Model parameters used throughout PM.

joyce2000.title: Compact Manifolds with Special Holonomy
joyce2000.description: Definitive mathematical treatment of G₂ manifolds and exceptional holonomy. Provides rigorous foundation for the geometric framework underlying PM's compactification from 7D to 4D.

joyce2017.title: A new construction of compact torsion-free G₂-manifolds by gluing families of Eguchi-Hanson spaces
joyce2017.description: Modern construction technique for compact G₂ manifolds via twisted connected sums. Directly relevant to PM's use of TCS G₂ manifolds for 7D compactification.

kovalev2003.title: Twisted connected sums and special Riemannian holonomy
kovalev2003.description: Original construction of compact G₂ manifolds via twisted connected sums. Foundation for PM's TCS #187 manifold topology.

superk2017.title: Search for proton decay via p → e⁺π⁰ and p → μ⁺π⁰ in 0.31 megaton-years exposure of the Super-Kamiokande water Cherenkov detector
superk2017.description: Current experimental lower bound on proton lifetime: τ_p > 1.6×10³⁴ years. Critical constraint for GUT-scale physics predictions in PM framework.

planck2018.title: Planck 2018 results. VI. Cosmological parameters
planck2018.description: CMB temperature anisotropy measurements providing cosmological parameters including H₀, Ωₘ, Ωₖ, σ₈, and S₈. Essential cosmological constraints for dark energy and matter content.

atiyah_witten_2001.title: M-Theory Dynamics on a Manifold of G₂ Holonomy
atiyah_witten_2001.journal: Advances in Theoretical and Mathematical Physics
atiyah_witten_2001.description: Comprehensive analysis of M-theory compactification on G₂ manifolds, including membrane instantons and gauge group emergence. Theoretical foundation for PM's M-theory approach.

acharya1998.title: M Theory, Joyce Orbifolds and Super Yang-Mills
acharya1998.journal: Advances in Theoretical and Mathematical Physics
acharya1998.description: Derivation of 4D N=1 supersymmetric Yang-Mills theories from M-theory on singular G₂ manifolds. Shows how gauge groups emerge from topology.

acharya2018.authors: Acharya, B.S., Kerr, M., Rauh, N., Zimet, M.
acharya2018.title: G-flux, topology, and the effective action for M-theory moduli
acharya2018.description: Analysis of moduli stabilization in M-theory on G₂ manifolds with G-flux. Relevant to PM's moduli dynamics and vacuum selection.

sethi_vafa_witten_1996.authors: Sethi, S., Vafa, C., Witten, E.
sethi_vafa_witten_1996.title: Constraints on low-dimensional string compactifications
sethi_vafa_witten_1996.description: Derives the generation formula n_gen = χ/24 for F-theory compactifications using D3-brane index theorem. Key reference for understanding generation counting from topology.

bars2006.title: Gauge Symmetry in Phase Space, Consequences for Physics and Spacetime
bars2006.journal: International Journal of Modern Physics A
bars2006.description: Sp(2,R) gauge symmetry in two-time physics. The three constraints X²=0, X·P=0, P²+M²=0 eliminate ghosts from the second time dimension. Foundation for PM's 2T-physics framework.

einstein1915.title: Die Feldgleichungen der Gravitation (The Field Equations of Gravitation)
einstein1915.journal: Sitzungsberichte der Preussischen Akademie der Wissenschaften zu Berlin
einstein1915.description: Original formulation of Einstein's field equations relating spacetime curvature to energy-momentum. Foundation of general relativity.

yang_mills_1954.title: Conservation of Isotopic Spin and Isotopic Gauge Invariance
yang_mills_1954.description: Introduction of non-Abelian gauge theories. Foundation for the Standard Model's SU(3)×SU(2)×U(1) structure.

kaluza1921.title: Zum Unitätsproblem der Physik (On the Unification Problem of Physics)
kaluza1921.journal: Sitzungsberichte der Preussischen Akademie der Wissenschaften
kaluza1921.description: First proposal to unify gravity and electromagnetism via a fifth dimension. Historical foundation for Kaluza-Klein theory and extra dimensions.

klein1926.title: Quantentheorie und fünfdimensionale Relativitätstheorie
klein1926.description: Quantum treatment of Kaluza's fifth dimension with compactification. Establishes the Kaluza-Klein framework.

lovelace1971.title: Pomeron form factors and dual Regge cuts
lovelace1971.description: First calculation showing D=26 critical dimension for bosonic string from Virasoro anomaly cancellation. Historical foundation for string theory critical dimensions.

minkowski1977.title: μ → eγ at a Rate of One Out of 10⁹ Muon Decays?
minkowski1977.description: Original proposal of the seesaw mechanism for neutrino masses. Explains small neutrino masses via heavy right-handed neutrinos.

gellmann1979.authors: Gell-Mann, M., Ramond, P., Slansky, R.
gellmann1979.title: Complex Spinors and Unified Theories
gellmann1979.description: Independent formulation of the seesaw mechanism in context of grand unified theories.

tomita1967.title: On Canonical Forms of von Neumann Algebras
tomita1967.journal: Fifth Functional Analysis Symposium, Tohoku University
tomita1967.description: Foundation of Tomita-Takesaki theory relating modular automorphisms to time evolution in von Neumann algebras. Mathematical basis for thermal time.

takesaki1970.title: Tomita's Theory of Modular Hilbert Algebras and its Applications
takesaki1970.description: Comprehensive development of Tomita's modular theory with applications to operator algebras.

kubo1957.title: Statistical-Mechanical Theory of Irreversible Processes. I.
kubo1957.journal: Journal of the Physical Society of Japan
kubo1957.description: Statistical mechanics foundation for linear response theory. Part of KMS condition development.

martin_schwinger_1959.title: Theory of Many-Particle Systems. I.
martin_schwinger_1959.description: Many-body theory with thermal equilibrium conditions. Completes KMS (Kubo-Martin-Schwinger) condition framework.

connes_rovelli_1994.title: Von Neumann Algebra Automorphisms and Time-Thermodynamics Relation
connes_rovelli_1994.description: Thermal time hypothesis connecting time evolution to thermodynamic entropy in quantum gravity. Basis for PM's thermal time emergence.

georgi_glashow_1974.title: Unity of All Elementary-Particle Forces
georgi_glashow_1974.description: First grand unified theory using SU(5) gauge group. Historical foundation for GUT physics.

fritzsch_minkowski_1975.title: Unified Interactions of Leptons and Hadrons
fritzsch_minkowski_1975.description: SO(10) grand unified theory encompassing both quarks and leptons. Provides framework for generation structure.

kklt2003.authors: Kachru, S., Kallosh, R., Linde, A., Trivedi, S.P.
kklt2003.title: de Sitter vacua in string theory
kklt2003.description: KKLT mechanism for moduli stabilization in string theory using fluxes and non-perturbative effects. Influential approach to vacuum selection.

candelas1985.authors: Candelas, P., Horowitz, G., Strominger, A., Witten, E.
candelas1985.title: Vacuum Configurations for Superstrings
candelas1985.description: Heterotic string compactification on Calabi-Yau threefolds. Historic paper establishing CY compactifications (contrast with PM's G₂ approach).

atiyah_singer_1968.title: The Index of Elliptic Operators on Compact Manifolds
atiyah_singer_1968.description: Atiyah-Singer index theorem relating analytical index to topological invariants. Foundation for understanding chirality and generation counting from topology.

clifford1878.title: Applications of Grassmann's Extensive Algebra
clifford1878.description: Introduction of Clifford algebras. Mathematical foundation for spinor representations and Dirac equation.

dirac1928.title: The Quantum Theory of the Electron
dirac1928.journal: Proceedings of the Royal Society A
dirac1928.description: Dirac equation for relativistic electrons. Foundation of spinor field theory and prediction of antimatter.

bryant1987.title: Metrics with Exceptional Holonomy
bryant1987.description: First explicit construction of complete metrics with G₂ holonomy. Proves existence of G₂ manifolds.

corti2015.authors: Corti, A., Haskins, M., Nordström, J., Pacini, T.
corti2015.title: G₂-manifolds and associative submanifolds via semi-Fano 3-folds
corti2015.description: Explicit TCS construction of G₂ manifolds with detailed examples. Relevant to PM's specific TCS #187 manifold.

joyce2007.title: Riemannian Holonomy Groups and Calibrated Geometry
joyce2007.description: Comprehensive treatment of special holonomy groups (G₂, Spin(7)) and calibrated submanifolds. Essential reference for associative 3-cycles, coassociative 4-cycles, and calibration theory underlying PM's geometric framework.

bars2000.title: Survey of Two-Time Physics
bars2000.description: Foundational survey of two-time physics framework. Introduces Sp(2,R) gauge symmetry, demonstrates how 1T physics emerges as gauge-fixed holographic projection of 2T physics. Critical theoretical foundation for PM's (25+1)D → (3+1)D reduction and dark energy predictions.

perelman2002.title: The Entropy Formula for the Ricci Flow and its Geometric Applications
perelman2002.description: Revolutionary work on Ricci flow with surgery, proving the Poincare and Thurston geometrization conjectures. The F-functional and W-entropy provide mathematical foundation for PM's connection between geometric flow, entropy, and time emergence.

perelman2003a.title: Ricci Flow with Surgery on Three-Manifolds
perelman2003a.description: Technical details of Ricci flow with surgery. Provides mathematical machinery for understanding how geometric structures evolve and simplify, relevant to PM's approach to compactification dynamics.

hamilton1982.title: Three-manifolds with positive Ricci curvature
hamilton1982.description: Original introduction of Ricci flow for geometric analysis. Establishes the parabolic PDE framework that Perelman later extended. Historical foundation for geometric flows in PM.

witten1995.title: String Theory Dynamics in Various Dimensions
witten1995.description: Foundational paper establishing M-theory as the strong-coupling limit of Type IIA string theory, with 11-dimensional supergravity as low-energy limit. Critical for PM's use of M-theory compactification.

hull_townsend_1995.title: Unity of Superstring Dualities
hull_townsend_1995.description: Establishes the U-duality web connecting various string theories and M-theory. Important for understanding the non-perturbative structure underlying PM.
